climbs.name: Yoshimi Battles the Giant Pink Robot

content.description: This line lies to the left of the bolt line and follows the corner up to and over the small roof.
content.protection: 3 bolts put in by FRO and Andy August 2019.

content.description:
"A steep delicate sport line. Tricky to figure out the best sequence, but good pump fun."

 Fairbanks Area Rock Climbing Guide FRO and SJ
content.protection: 3 bolts and bolted anchors with quick-links.
content.location: Middle line on south face of Lower Pop Rock. Only bolted line.

content.description: Great moves wander up this face over bulges and onto sloping ledges. Also, beware! this is the loosest climb at Grapefruit and that is saying something. Loose rock is also the reason for the lack of sport bolts on this route.
content.protection: Top rope bolts. Single bolt nearby to protect the anchor-builder.

content.description: This thin, steep line lies to the right of Sporty Spice. Fun, crimpy moves up to several good pockets.
content.location: Bolted line to the right of Sporty Spice. Farthest right bolted line on Lower Pop Rocks face.

content.description: The Lower Pop Rock is uphill (West) of the trail that takes you to Crackland. The 3 routes that exist are south facing and short. Unfortunately, this crag and the Upper Pop Rock are not destination spots but if you're heading to Crackland and you want to tick off some routes than they might deserve a stopover.
